page.title: 01The Area Around Anstey.
page.content: Anstey,Meesden and Brent Pelham are small villages in the Hertfordshire countryside.There are only a few hundred people in each.The land around is almost entirely farmland,with small copses and woods.There is one large stretch of woodland called Scales Park.The farmland is mainly arable with some dairy,pig and chicken farming. Most of the people work outside the villages,travelling to nearby towns or into London and all but a few children are bussed to nearby town schools. It is a quiet area with few recreational facilities although many fund raising functions are held throughout the year.Many of the people have chosen to live in the area because of the quiet.There are some historical sites such as the castle mound,the church and many moats.
